title: Anivia should proc double E damage on frosted enemies, even if they're from other players.
body:
I don't mean all slows, Cassiopeia doesn't proc the lowered E cooldown on Brands fire, ignite, or Malzahars E, but does so with Teemo's E and R.

But ones that give the snowflake effects, like Lissandra, Ashe and Rylai's. It won't be OP as a team with 4 Rylai's will be late enough game for Anivia to have a ton of mana from tear and/or RoA to keep R on for a long long time, but it helps with support with Ashe lanes in laning phase when AoE abilities push the minion wave and Qs cooldown is longer than E (and usually before lvl 6)

I think it's only fair Cassiopeia + Teemo lanes are really fun, but now that slows don't stack, Ashe and Anivia lanes aren't good at all.

replies.body:
no thanks

i dont want anivia buffs

No one even plays Anivia support...

Unless the Jungler is Ashe, it's not much of a buff to normal, solo lane Anivia in general

In fact, I've never seen another Anivia player before in game... They appear less than Swain and Yorick players

No, you dont see many support anivia's, most people play her mid where her E does over 1000 dmg, her whole counterplay revolves around avoiding the buffed E damage, and if every champ with a slow related to ice gave her that 2x damage for free, her teamfight potential would be crazy, you mention that its not much of a buff to solo lane anivia, you should remember that the laning phase only lasts 10/15 min, the other 40 min you are team fighting (with ashe, liss, sej etc) and the 'not much of a buff' becomes a real problem. 

Also anivia's pick rate is 2.27% and yorick's is 1.05% so she is picked over twice as many times as yorick, swain is roughly the same as anivia.

Remember also that anivia's 'chilled' and ashes' 'frost' are different de-buffs, its not like teemo/singed where its the same poison. both chilled and frost slow the opponent but that doesn't make them the same thing.
Brands passive, cass's poison, fizz's W, malz's E, naught's W, singed's Q, Swain's E, twitch's passive, Morde's R, Trundle's R, Caitlin's traps and teemo's posion. are all AP scaling DoT abilities, that do exactly the same thing as poison, imagine if Cass's E reset on ALL of those, be kinda OP right? 
well actually it resets on Twitch's poison too despite it being a different effect to normal poison, (not having the little bubbling particle) it doesnt even do magic damage it does true damage, so that means we can include not only AP scaling DoT abilities, but true damage and AD ones too, the list now includes: 
Darius's passive, Gangplanks passive, Talons Q and Udyr's Q. 
But of course we are forgetting that both singed and her own poisons are AoE too, so if AoT DoT abilities count then we need to add: Alistar's passive, Ammumu's W, Anivia's R, Annies R, Fiddle's R, Garen's spin, Hec's W, Karthus' E, Kennen's R, Lissandra's R, Maokai's R, MF's E, Morde's W, Morgana's W, Nasus' R, Rammus's R, Renek's R, Rumble's Q and R, Shyvanna's W, Urgots E, Viktor's R, Vlad's W and Wukong's R, to the list. 
heres where you say "well you're just being stupid now" but actually if you look at it, those abilities are no different to 'poisons' they do the same thing, lets compare Teemo's Posion and Fizz's W for a second, they are both AP scaling DoT AA buffs, that do the same thing. So in all respects fizz does have a poison. Taking that logic into account, all the aforementioned champion's abilities fit the Requirements to reset Cass's E, but they don't because Cass would have a 100% ban rate if that was the case, so they classify what is a poison and what isn't by name alone, and so if they judge it by name alone, that means that Anivia's 'Chilled' IS indeed different to Ashe's 'Frost' therefore if the rule was to be broken and anivia's Frostbite dealt double damage to targets with ashe's 'frost' then the 'poison' rule would not apply either and Cass would have all the previously mentioned champions reset her E. (also by default Urgots Q would be homing on all those abilities too) its similar to Yasuo's wind wall, regardless of what the ability actually is, if it is named a projectile then it is blocked, Ezreals Ult which is an ult and does mega damage is blocked, where xerath's Q which is a non-ultmate ability on a short cooldown and deals less damage isn't blocked, you'd think it would make more sense balance wise to work the other way around, but because of the wording of yasuo's wall, one ability is blocked and the other isn't. 
Morale: wording is important,

And of course this doesn't only affect anivia, "if a door is opened it can be crossed through from both sides" which means ashe's basic attacks would crit on targets afflicted with anivia's 'chilled' and Rylai's slow as well, which would be kinda slightly OP, anivia would stun a target and ashe could crit straight away. Even if anivia wasn't in the game, if someone had rylai's ashe would crit on them too, Sejuani could also use her permafrost on targets with rylai's or ashe/anivia slows, and henceforth ashe and anivia could get bonus damage off her passive effect too, not to mention that Anivia's R is AoE and would allow ashe to crit instantly on the whole team, and allow Sej to slow everyone.

in short a change like you suggest not only tips the scales even more so in the favour of an already very powerful mage (anivia) but in applying the change you affect several other aspects of the game, (RIOT's balancing team has it harder than you think aye) 

although i do see where you are coming from don't get me wrong, (i still believe lee sin shouldnt be affected by blind) and in my opinion i believe that anivia should be able to use her buffed E against the dragon, but she cant because dragon is immune to CC and thus isn't affected by 'chilled'. My problem with this is that 'chilled' isn't a form of CC but 'Slow' is, so dragon should block the 'slow' aspect of chilled but not the 'chilled' part. An example would be Azir's Q, yes it has a slow but dragon doesn't block the whole ability does it?

I actually enjoyed reading this.. Although I am guilty of somewhat skim reading parts of it cause I'm actually very sleep deprived atm.
But I see what you're saying about poisons..
Simply allowing Anivia to proc double E damage on Ashe's frosted targets wouldn't be allowed and I agree 100% on that. I was thinking they change one of the debuffs to the same debuff. e.g. They both apply frost, or both applied chilled. And the description of Anivia's E is instead changed to "frosted" or "chilled" whichever the other is changed to. By no means should this apply to every champion with a similar effect JUST because it slows them.
IMO the only champions that could -or- should apply frost/chilled would be: Ashe, Anivia, Braum, Lissandra, Nunu, Sejuani and Trundle.
This is probably cause I'm a fan of games with status effects like poisoned, burned, frozen etc, so I'd personally like them to be the same and there to be more benefits from said effects ^^

Even if they did apply this change though the chances a random Anivia would end up on the same team as one of the other 6 champions I listed would be pretty damn low (since there's another whole 120 champions to chose from) -unless- it was an organised comp with that strategy in mind so even if this 'buff' goes ahead I really don't think you'll ever have to worry about it. :)
Yeah... The only counter argument I had was the fact these champs have a really low chance of being with Anivia, who already isn't commonly picked from my ELO.

Well, firstly, Ashe only takes one auto attack to slow anyway, so isn't wasting an ability a bit rash?

Also, by the time team fights start I usually can just place down my R and spam E without worrying, or if I'm behind I just place it and remove it when needed (The only times E is off cooldown while R isn't is when I get really unlucky)

Finally, DoT is very different for each case while slows only come in yellow trails and blue snowflakes, with nearly all being yellow slows.

I'm not too sure though
Yes but the difference is, if this were a thing, you build 40% CDR and AP rather then building mana, which is the counterplay.

Ok you're definitely right with that. Removing the need for R can help a ton with mana even though I remove mine as soon as one I can reactivate to save mana.

If only Anivia's mana issues stemmed from the result rather than the set up, like Cassiopeia :(

1 AA is more of a deal than you think, if its not a big deal for ashe then, The counter argument is that vayne takes 3 AA's to kill you, so if just one AA isn't a big deal then I'm sure no-one would mind if we took one away and she only needed 2 AA's to proc her silver bolts? i somehow don't think that'll end well., its the same with ashe, if it takes 1 AA less to proc her damage, its no different to vayne. 

Yea thats the plan, just put R down and spam E in a  team fight, but what if enemy naught was waiting for you to use it and as soon as you do he jumps on you disrupting it, giving the people who were in it time to escape, and now you're defenceless, you can Q naught to escape but then you lack your double E damage for when your original targets turn back on you, you could use it on naught but thats not going to bother him much. Of course of there was an ashe in the team it would be different, 1 volley and their whole team is wide open for your E. Or you miss Q and R is on CD and you have nothing but a wall to play with vsing a yasuo who's after your soul, if ashe hits him with a long range volley tho then you can half his health instantly and give him second thoughts.

the only difference between yellow and blue slows is the visual effect, they put ice slows on ice champs for the same reason they put fire particles on brands passive. Not all poison slows yet cass's E resets on them regardless.

Removing one auto attack per three is completely different from removing one auto attack per kite or enemy. Also, a poison that doesn't slow isn't very different from any other DoT so I don't get your point there either. Why doesn't Cassiopeia E proc on Malzahar's?
